home.subtitle: Classic Strategy Board Game
home.localDesc: Play with a friend on the same screen
home.rule2: Surround opponent pieces to flip them
home.rule3: The player with more pieces wins!

howToPlay.basic1: Black and white take turns placing pieces on an 8×8 board. Black goes first.
howToPlay.basic2: The game starts with 2 black and 2 white pieces placed diagonally in the center.
howToPlay.basic3: If you have no valid moves, your turn is automatically skipped.
howToPlay.flip1: Place your piece to surround opponent pieces horizontally, vertically, or diagonally — all surrounded pieces flip to your color.
howToPlay.flip2: You can flip pieces in multiple directions at once.
howToPlay.flip3: You can only place a piece where it flips at least one opponent piece.
howToPlay.strategy1: Corners can never be flipped, so capturing them gives a big advantage.
howToPlay.strategy2: Placing next to a corner can give your opponent the corner — be careful!
howToPlay.strategy3: In the early game, focus on mobility (available moves) rather than piece count.
howToPlay.end1: The game ends when neither player can make a move or the board is full.
howToPlay.end2: The player with more pieces wins. Equal pieces means a tie.
howToPlay.online1: Each turn has a 30-second time limit. If time runs out, the turn passes.
howToPlay.online2: If disconnected, you have 30 seconds to reconnect. After that, it counts as a forfeit.
howToPlay.online3: Leaving mid-game counts as a forfeit. Frequent forfeits result in cooldown penalties.
howToPlay.online4: ELO rating system matches you with players of similar skill.
